item.title: Using the entity-relationship model
item.description: The task of creating a database application begins with the needs of the target users. For small applications it is feasible for a database designer who understand the applications to decide directly on the relations that are created, their attributes, and their constraints. Such a direct design process is difficult for real-world applications because they are often highly complex. The database design process must then be split into several phases.
